greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n for which A328403(n) = A276086(A276086(A276086(n))) is squarefree.
comment: Numbers n such that A276086(n) is in A328836, or equally, that A276087(n) is in A276156, i.e., numbers n for which A328828(A276087(n)) is zero, that is, numbers n such that in the primorial base expansion of A276087(n) there are no digits larger than 1.

All the terms of A328313 are included also in this sequence. Questions: Is that sequence finite? Even if it is, is this one also? Are there any terms here between 2312 and 3217644767340672907899084554132 ? Are there only finitely many numbers n for which A328828(A328403(n)) is zero? (See comments in A328398).
link: Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
A328828(n) = { my(i=1, p=2); while(n, if((n%p)>1, return(i)); i++; n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (0); };
xref: Positions of ones in A328394. See also comments in A328398.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 30 2019
